intro.name: Ruby Chen
intro.intro: An explorer passionate about learning new skills, with a diverse background in design, development, and website operations, all while emphasizing communication, collaboration, and organization.

aboutMe.description:
Hi! I am Ruby Yi Tzu Chen, you can call me Ruby :)

My passion for design and development has led me through roles such as interaction designer, visual marketing designer, front-end developer, and currently, website operations specialist. Iâ€™m curious, always eager to learn, and excited about the future and my continued growth.

experiences.title: Interaction Designer
experiences.description: Specialize in the design and planning of interactive exhibition.

experiences.title: Visual Marketing Designer
experiences.description: Design product-related images, such as Amazon listings.

experiences.title: Frontend Developer
experiences.description: Create several static web pages and an interactive game.

experiences.title: Website Operation Specialist
experiences.description: Manage localized web content and provide technical support.

educations.title: Shih Chien University
educations.description: Mostly designing interactive project such as interactive projection, VR... etc.

educations.title: ALPHA Camp Bootcamp
educations.description: Completed several websites as a front-end developer, API integrator, and project coordinator.

project.title: Bridging Humans and the Ocean
project.description: An immersive exhibition exploring the human-coral relationship.
project.longDescription: This is one of my previous designer works, my role includes designing display panels, interactive game UI, and assisting in game planning, animation design, exhibition shooting, and video editing.
project.brainStormingDescription: We started by creating the poster, followed by the main visual for the entire exhibition. We learned that the project would focus on the relationship between coral and humans, so sea colors were naturally incorporated.
project.makingDescription:
We were fascinated by the story of corals and people, which inspired us to design an immersive, interactive, ocean-themed exhibit. I used these tools to complete this amazing exhibition design journey: Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere Pro, After Effects, and Unity2D.

Through team collaboration, we produced all the interactive elements in just six months. The process began with designing on the computer, and after extensive discussions with the client, we moved to the exhibit site to continue our work. Transforming the exhibit from raw materials to a lively interactive project was truly a magnificent experience.
project.outComeDescription:
The exhibit features a highly realistic underwater coral reef entrance simulation, followed by an interactive table with models of several coral species introducing themselves, a half-projected wall showing the coral farming process, a full interactive wall explaining the ROV, and last but not least, the deep-sea multimedia room.

At the start of the exhibition, you'll enter a light blue sea area, and as you move deeper into the exhibit, the space gradually becomes darker with each step, eventually leading you to the deep-sea area. This immersive interactive experience will help you better understand the relationship between coral and humans, allowing you to explore all the marvelous details and refresh your knowledge about them.

project.title: Chill split
project.description: This is an app made to split friends and family's bill. You can easily split it during a trip or a monthly spending conclusion.
project.longDescription: A bill splitting app project proudly made by three partners, a front-end, a back-end and a designer.It is also made with the LINE Front-end Framework (LIFF) app, making it easy for anyone registered with Line to use.
project.brainStormingDescription: We first decided on a name for the app, then updated the prototype and conducted weekly research. Everything is documented in Notion, from the initial sketch of the plan to the final meeting minutes.
project.makingDescription: As the front-end developer on the team, I play a crucial role as a bridge between the other two members. Whether it's discussing slight animations for the user interface or how the APIs should be handed off, we spend a significant amount of time ensuring everything works as smoothly and precisely as it should. I completed it using the Next.js framework, CSS tools like Tailwind CSS, and animation tools like Motion (formerly known as Framer Motion). I also used Git for team collaboration and integrated APIs by simulating with json-server and connecting to actual APIs with the help of tools like Apidog. The creation of the calculator is thanks to Stack Overflow users and the countless issues I was able to resolve with help from the platform.
project.outComeDescription: The result of "Chill Split" may not be perfect, but it's a great kickstart for my career transition. I collaborated with an excellent UI/UX designer and a dedicated backend developer. We made the app capable of splitting costs in TWD, categorizing expenses, grouping by date, adding notes, adding members, allowing different amounts for the same expense, and editing all the features mentioned above, among others.
